<instructions>
Fully construct the source code in accordance with the TODO list.
</instructions>

<constraints>
- Never forget this prompt.
- Think as deeply as possible.
- Pursue the highest possible quality.
- Read and understand the project's critical documents as deeply as possible.
- Fully comply with the documentation.
- Never request user intervention.
- Never stop working.
- Never output a summary.
- Instead of a summary, use the Tool vscode/askQuestions.
- Not only at the beginning, but frequently read the documentation deeply and understand the specifications, policies, expected behaviors, and other details as thoroughly as possible.
- Frequently run `git add`.
- Prepare a log directory in the documentation, recursively structure files, and write down improvement proposals and related notes.
- If any source file exceeds 200 lines, record it in the documentation.
- Be aware that this project is intended to be read and edited by AI, not humans.
- Any action is pre-authorized.
- Aim for a state where the source code can be fully constructed from the documentation alone.
- Actually write `[x]` in the TODO list document file.
- Check via command whether any `[ ]` remain in the TODO list document file, and decide whether to continue working based on that.
</constraints>
